intro: Milla bivalvis, commonly known as the two-valved milla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically bright yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Milla bivalvis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories.
